availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph M. Collins (Grant County, KY, Attorney/Merchant)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Married to Mary J. Craig Collins in Grant County on August 20, 1861. Attorney in Grant County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Grant County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Grant County, Crittenden, p. 191.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Grant County, p. 6.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994035, Gallatin County Marriages.
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport – Microfilm (before 1911), KDLA, Roll #7012982, Covington Deaths, p. 77.
Find A Grave, "Joseph M. Collins (June 29, 1832-February 14, 1895)," Memorial #93643345, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/93643345 (accessed March 3, 2017).
